page.title: 15What's in a Name- Sacriston
page.content:
{ SACRISTON}
The land around Sacriston was once owned by the Bishop of Durham. During the 13th Century the estate was given to the{Sacrist}of Durham Cathedral by Bishop Pudsey. The{Sacrist}was a monk whose job it was to provide everything necessary for the services in the Cathedral ie bread, wine and vestments. He was also required to feed 200 people on St Catherines Day - giving each a loaf and two herrings. The funds for carrying on the business in the Lands of the Sacrist came principally from the estate called Sacriston Heugh ( pronounced Seggerston Heuff ). The monks were mining coal in this area as long ago as 1321.
